subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






May 10, 2007

TOP STORIESBush Seeks Deal With Democrats On Iraq
Under growing political pressure, President Bush said the White House will seek agreement with Congress on benchmarks to measure
                        progress in Iraq. However, the president pledged to veto a bill that would cut off money for the war by the end of July. More...
• OxyContin's Deception Costs Firm $634M • Engineer Guilty In Military Secrets Case• Gonzales Faces New Round Of Questioning
                     					| WatchU.S.Colorado High School On Lockdown
Police launched a room-to-room search of Boulder High School before students arrived because a cook reported seeing two suspicious
                        men inside the building, both wearing camouflage and one wearing a ski mask. More...
• Engineer Guilty In Military Secrets Case• Weather Aids Florida Firefighters
                     					| Watch• Cop Avoids Charges For Making Pot Brownies• More StoriesWorldRevived Taliban Restrict Afghan Aid Effort
In the wake of Operation Medusa, in which hundreds of insurgents were killed, military officials hoped that development workers
                        would move in to fill the vacuum. But almost a year later, most of Afghanistan's four southern provinces are off limits. More...Watch: Taking A Taliban Stronghold
• Blair To Step Down On June 27
                     					| Watch• Putin Offers Blunt Victory Day Speech• Turkey Approves Popular Vote For President• More StoriesPoliticsGOP Moderates Warn Bush On Iraq
During a private, "frank" discussion with President Bush at the White House, a group of moderate Republicans warned Mr. Bush
                        that he would lose the support of his party if progress isn't demonstrated in Iraq, and soon. More...
• Gonzales Faces New Round Of Questioning
                     					| Watch• Fuel-Efficiency Bill "Full Of Holes"• Another Prosecutor Pushed Out?• More StoriesHealthNew Evidence Cervical Cancer Vaccine Works
Gardasil is designed to protect against the strains of human papilloma virus that cause most cases of the disease, and Dr.
                        Emily Senay says the latest clinical trials show it does the job. But, she adds, the Gardasil remains controversial. More...Watch: HVP Vaccine & Cancer
• OxyContin's Deception Costs Firm $634M • Cell Phone GPS Finds Transplant Patient
                     					| Watch• Safer Tobacco Alternative From Sweden?• More StoriesSciTechNYC Cabs Going High-Tech
The city's Taxi and Limousine Commission unanimously approved a plan to install touch-screen monitors in all 13,000 city cabs
                        over the objections of some drivers who consider the technology too expensive and intrusive. More...
• Cell Phone GPS Finds Transplant Patient
                     					| Watch• Fuel-Efficiency Bill "Full Of Holes"• Web Profiteering Off Va. Tech Massacre• More StoriesBusinessJetBlue Dumps CEO
JetBlue Airways Corp. replaced founder David Neeleman as CEO months after operating snafus essentially shut down the carrier
                        for days and frayed relations with customers. The low-fare airline appointed Chief Operating Officer Dave Barger. More...
• Tax Revenues Hit Record High In April• Guilty Pleas In Giant Insider-Trading Case• OxyContin's Deception Costs Firm $634M • More StoriesEntertainmentBrangelina's Biggest Problem? Quality Time
Does the world's most beautiful couple fight? "Not really. We'll get into issues about global events or something that was
                        just on the news," Angelina Jolie tells Readers Digest in a new interview. More...Watch: Jolie On Adopting Orphan Kids
• Depp Opens Up About Daughter's Sickness
                     					| Watch• LaKisha Sings Her Last Song On "Idol"
                     					| Watch• HBO Chief Forced Out After Assault Arrest• More StoriesOpinionCounting The Bentleys
Conspicuous consumers need to think about the message they intend to send, writes CBSNews.com's Dick Meyer. More...
• A Prescription For Details
                     					| Watch• Leaving Iraq Puts More Than U.S. At Risk
                     					| Watch• Tenet Chose Power Over Honor
                     					| Watch• More StoriesCBS NEWS BROADCASTSThe Early Show: Williams-Sonoma: Perfect Lunch For Mom
Tori Ritchie serves up simple and delicious recipes for a Mother's Day menu. Why not give her a home-cooked meal, rather
                        than heading out to a restaurant? More...

Missouri Copes With FloodingIn Levasey, Mo., homes and crops now sit beneath a few feet of water. State officials say that many levees along the Missouri,
                                    Platte and Grand Rivers have breached. Manuel Gallegus reports.
